intro: Sebaea condensata, commonly known as the silverleaf sebaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its succulent stems and leaves make it drought-tolerant, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. Sebaea condensata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and low maintenance requirements.
